alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff, southwestern Sioux and east central Goshen Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 637 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Torr the eastern part of the country will keep an upper-level trough near stationary over western CONUS. Daily precipitation chances will be likely as the CWA sits under the downstream side of the trough. Model soundings continue to indicate a tall, skinny CAPE profile on Thursday with SBCAPE values between 500 and 2000 J/kg. PW values remain above the 90th percentile of climatology with moist low-levels. Again, this will mainington, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lyman, Yoder, Huntley and Henry. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
